_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:52:24 using v0.9
title: How has the QOF clinical domain achievement changed?
analysis_commentary: Comparisons over time are difficult as the QOF targets are recalibrated at various points. It is clear, however, that the vast majority of England's GP practices are performing well across the disease management areas, with little variation in performance level in the last six years. In 20011/12, the average national performance across domain areas (unweighted) is 96.0%, although there are a couple of conditions where performance against the metrics is relatively lower (depression averages 86.5% over the last six years and palliative care 91.5%). There is also a noticeable drop in the achievement against the learning disabilities indicator group between 2010/11 and 2011/12, from 99.2% to 83.5%.
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, Quality and Outcomes Framework
